body_text.text: Covid-19 is a world threating virus and more than 300,000 people suffer from Covid-19. This disease is rapidly transmitted worldwide. To automatically detect this disease, we propose a novel machine learning method. In infectious diseases, machine learning methods should be used in critical tasks. Therefore, our main motivation is to detect Covid-19 by using a computer vision method (without human).

Studies on Covid-19 disease that appeared in December 2019 are limited. Many of these limited studies are for the recognition of the Covid-19 virus [13, 14] . Also, some studies have been conducted on the effects of this disease on humans [15] [16] [17] [18] [19] . At the same time, the treatment of the Coronavirus and the processes occurring after it have been examined by Zhang et. al. In the study, the possible conditions of the patient who was treated on Covid-19 disease and discharged were examined [2] . Covid-19 was examined in terms of dermatologists by Darlenski and Tsankov. They presented the effects of extreme hygiene measures on the skin and the factors that dermatologists will consider in this regard [20] . [26] provided automatic pneumonia diagnosis in infants through computer-aided systems from radiographic images. In this system, pneumonia data is classified using three classifiers. The classifiers used are Support Vector Machines, K-Nearest Neighbor and Naïve Bayes. In this study, it was determined that the most suitable classifier for the available data is Support Vector Machines. Pneumonia disease was identified and classified by chest x-ray images by Jaiswal et al. [27] . In this study, deep convolutional neural network method was used. The main purpose of using this method is to provide an effective acquisition of local and global features of chest X-ray images. In this study, NIH CXR14 [28] dataset was used. In the study, the evaluation parameter mean threshold value and mean score was selected. Liang and Zheng [29] have developed a smart system for child Pneumonia disease. The convolutional neural network method was used in the developed system and the performance of Kermany [30] dataset was used. In this study, accuracy, precision, recall, f1-score, and AUC were used as evaluation criteria. The accuracy value was calculated as 90.5% in the proposed method. Sirazitdinov et al. interpreted chest x-ray images with machine learning techniques. RSNA Pneumonia Detection Challenge dataset [31] was used in the study. In the study, precision, recall, F1-score were used to evaluate the results.

To detect Covid-19 flu, a novel method is presented. This method consists of preprocessing, feature extraction with ResExLBP, feature selection with IRF and classification phases. In the preprocessing phase, the input X-ray image is transformed into grayscale image and is resized 512 x 512 sized image. ResExLBP divides input image into 128 x 128 sized exemplars and LBP extracts feature from the input image and exemplars of it. The generated features are concatenated and discriminative ones of them are selected by using IRF. The selected features by IRF are utilized as input of the classifiers by using LOOCV and 10-fold CV.
The contributions of the proposed ResExLBP and IRF based Corona detection method are given in below.

• LBP is one of the widely used feature extractors in the literature and is effective method. It generates low-level features. Therefore, LBP cannot effectively solve some problems, for instance, facial expression recognition. Therefore, exemplar LBP was presented to extracted middle and low-level features. In this work, we proposed

ResExLBP feature extraction method. It uses both LBP and exemplar LBP together to extract low, middle and high-level features. • ReliefF is one of the most preferred distance based feature selector. It is a parametric feature selector. To automated feature selection, we presented a novel iterative ReliefF based feature selector (IRF).
• To obtain general performance, LOOCV and 10-fold CV are used in this work. Five classifiers were also selected to show the general success of the proposed ResExLBP and IRF based method.
• The proposed ResExLBP and IRF based method reached perfect classification rate (100.0%) for Corona detection by using X-ray images.

To show effectiveness of the proposed ResExLBP and IRF based method, we used 5 classifiers. These classifiers are DT [41, 42] , LD [43] , kNN [44] , SVM [45] and SD [46] . To show general success of the proposed method, we tested the optimal features by using LOOCV and 10-fold CV. In the LOOCV, there is no random assignment. Therefore, it gives one accuracy value. 10-fold CV uses random selection, hence, we executed it 1000 times to evaluate general results. MATLAB Classification Learner (MCL) was used to execute these classifiers. We used default settings for these classifiers. Parameters of the used classifiers are shown in Table 1 .
Covid-19 causes lung viral infection and the proposed ResExLBP and IRF based method aimed to detect this viral infection. Therefore, we collected a dataset from Kaggle and Github.
There are 321 lung X-ray images in this dataset. 87 of these X-ray images have belonged to

Covid-19 and 234 of them have belonged to healthy subjects. In this section, we tested our proposed method on this dataset. This dataset is heterogeneous because there are 87 coronas and 234 healthy subjects. If a classifier predicts all of them healthy, it achieved 234/321=72.89% classification accuracy. LOOCV and 10-fold CV are used for testing and training. We selected them to obtain robust results. The obtained LOOCV results are listed in Table 2 . To calculate general results by using 10-fold CV, classifiers were executed 1000 times and the obtained average, standard deviation, and maximum values were also shown in Table 3 . As seen from Table 3 , SVM achieved 100.0% classification accuracy and general success rate of the SVM was calculated as 99.55%±0.17%. Tables 2 and 3 clearly shown that the best classifier is SVM and the worst resulted classifier is DT. SD and LD achieved same success rates by using LOOCV but LD reached higher success rate than SD by using 10-fold CV. The scatter plot of the extracted features is shown in Fig. 3 . • We presented a novel automated Covid-19 detection method with high accuracy.

In this paper, we proposed two novel methods to accurately detect corona patients by using lung X-ray images. The proposed methods are ResExLBP feature extraction and IRF feature selection methods. The main objective of the ResExLBP is to extract meaningful features and IRF is proposed to select most discriminative features. The selected most discriminative features were classified by using 5 methods with LOOCV and 10-fold CV. The proposed ResExLBP and IRF based method achieved 99.69% and 100.0% classification accuracy by using SVM with LOOCV and 10-fold CV respectively. Robust classification results rates were calculated by using LOOCV and 10-fold CV. We also showed number of errors in Table   1 .
Interesting future directions are given below.

• Corona is a deadly virus and it has been seen worldwide. Smart health systems should be used to detect Covid-19 quickly. A novel smart heath assistant can be developed by using the proposed ResExLBP and IRF together. • Quarantine is one of the applied effective methods to prevent the spread of the coronavirus (Covid-19). It is very important to establish unmanned health units to track patients in quarantine and protect health workers. In these units, intelligent systems can be used to track patients and these systems can be developed by using machine learning method as the proposed ResExLBP and IRF based method.
• To solve other biomedical image problems, the proposed model can be used as a solution method.
• The residual exemplar is a basic model. In this work, we used LBP in this model.
Researchers can be used other feature extractors in the residual exemplar model and they can propose novel ResEx based methods.
